titleStmt.title: Alexander Hughes vs. King County Writ of Habeaus Corpus

bibl.title: Alexander Hughes v. King County Writ of Habeaus Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Know all men that her Bailey Gakert W. B. Hall John Langston Lewis McMullen L. v. M. Labe Jall A. L. W. Ballard George Harding J. H. Bandvery George W. A. Millerson A Johnson each and senesalyy acknowledge ourselves bound to Territory of Washington in the small sum of one hundred dollars each, each for himself bauful money of the United States for which we kind ourselves; our livers our adminstrations and assigns sealed with our seals and signed this sixth (6) day of September A. D. 1875. Now the condition of this obligation issued that if the above bounded parties appear to give endurance in the District Court of the third judicial district holding terms at Seattle for the counties of King, Kitsah and Samish either at the present term or at the next as the Judge there of shall determine to give evidence in a certain cause therein to the third wherein the territory of Washington is the Plantiff and one Alexander Hughes is the defendant to the void otherwise to sumin in fullness and virtue.
